newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Plane with six passengers missing in Philippines.
newsitem.headline: Plane with six passengers missing in Philippines.

text.p: A private twin-engine aircraft believed to be carrying six passengers was reported missing about 30 km (20 miles) from Manila airport on Thursday, the Air Transportation Office (ATO) said.
ATO officials said the plane left Lubang Island in central Philippines for Manila at 1:44 p.m. (0544 GMT). The last contact with the plane was at 2:21 p.m. (0621 GMT).
It vanished from radar screens shortly thereafter and ATO officials estimated it was at the time about 30 km from landing at Manila.
The Philippine Air Force contacted nearby airports but there was no record of the airplane making a landing.
The search will resume on Friday, the ATO said.
